plan: Plan to start by bidding at my exact value for A and B separately and observe outcomes. Then, I'll test bidding slightly above and below my value, in intervals of 5 dollars. If AB bids consistently win, I'll bid my combined value for AB. If acquiring individually seems more successful, I'll focus on the higher value item. My bidding strategy will adapt based on previous outcomes, becoming more aggressive in bidding when needed, and more conservative when competition is low, always maximizing my profit.

I'll test two strategies: 1) Bidding at face value for A due to its higher value and not bidding for B. 2) Placing aggressive bids for AB at a value slightly above the sum of individual values of A and B, say at 165. This could deter others from bidding on AB and might let me win both. I’ll then compare the outcomes and adapt my strategy accordingly, maximizing profit over time.

In the next rounds, I’ll test a high-risk strategy by bidding significantly on AB when my combined value is high, predicting others might not expect it. In rounds with low value for B but high for A, I'll bid aggressively on A, while anticipating competition for AB. I'll apply a balanced approach in rounds with evenly distributed values, bidding moderately on both goods. Adopting varied strategies across rounds will provide data on other bidders' reactions, enabling strategic refinement. I will also observe how results differ when I win A, B or AB individually to gauge profitability.

I plan to bid slightly above my value for A and B individually, around $5 higher. This could improve my chances of winning. Concurrently, I'll maintain my combined bid for AB at my exact value to continue testing its success rate.
This round, I'll bid just above the previous highest bids. I propose 9 for A, and withhold bidding for B. I will also aggressively bid 31 for AB, aiming for high profit potential.

I'll be aggressive on the AB bid as my combined value is high. I'll also increase bidding on A moderately, anticipating a potential win if a rival overbids on AB. I'll analyze if these aggressive strategies yield higher profit in this setup.

Plan to bid my exact value on A and B, and slightly above on AB. If consistently winning individual goods, will focus on bidding my value for higher value item and reduce bid on lower value item for future rounds.
For this round, I'll place bid of 13 for A, as it's my higher value, no bid for B. I'll set an exploratory bid for AB at my total value of 38 to gather data on competition’s response.

I'll aim for the A-B bundle with a high-risk bid, as my combined value is quite substantial. I'll also increase my bidding on A moderately, anticipating potential wins if rivals overbid on AB. Constant adaptation and tactical variation will be prioritized to maximize long-term profits.
Plan to lower my bids on A and B by 10% and raise my bid on AB to near valuation. Observe the impact on winning and profits. If successful, continue, otherwise adjust strategy accordingly.

Based on past strategy performance, I'll bid slightly above my current value for A ($27) and increase my bid for B to $20. Given the competitive nature of AB, I'll cap my bid to my valuation of $90 to avoid losses.

Considering the high value for AB, I'll bid aggressively for the AB bundle. Additionally, moderate bids on A and B individually will be made to potentially secure a win if opponents focus excessively on AB. Analyzing results, I'll continue refining my strategy to optimize long-term profits.

For this round, plan to bid my values on A and B. For AB, I'll bid nearing my valuation. I aim to analyze how profitable bidding at or very near personal values for individual items and bundles can be.
I'll build on my strategy by bidding moderately above my value for A and B individually, and considerably higher for AB bundle (around $233) to capitalize on the combined item value advantage.

Given the high combined value of 344 for AB, I plan to aggressively bid on AB. Concurrently, I'll moderately bid on A and B individually, possibly securing a win if rivals overbid on AB. Observing and adjusting actions based on previous results will stay crucial in refining my strategy.

I plan to increment my bids on A and B by $2 and $5 respectively to test the winning thresholds. Simultaneously, I'll increase my AB bid by $50 to determine the competitiveness for bundle bidding. I'll continue to analyze profit and adapt accordingly.

Employ dual strategy: continue bidding slightly above values for A & B, approximately 75 & 85. Test aggressive AB bid at $290, lower than previous round to assess competitors' responses. Aim to strike balance between winning bids and maximizing profit.

In this round, I'll slightly drop my bids for A, B, and AB. Even if this riskier approach results in loss, I'll gain valuable insights on bidder behavior in contingencies of lower bids, informing future bidding strategy refinement.

Next round, I'll bid $31 on A, $13 on B and raise my bid on AB to $90. If no wins, will elevate bids by $10 on individual items and by $15 on AB bundle while observing profits and adjusting approach as necessary.
Focus on reducing bid value but retaining winning position. Within the limit of potential leading bids, bid $60 on A, $53 on B, & $264 on AB, aiming to maximize profit by minimizing overspending.

I'll modify strategy by moderately raising individual bids to $60 for A and $30 for B. My AB bid will be aggressive at $160 to counterbalance. This balanced approach and assessing competitor tactics should inform future bids and maximize profit.
For the upcoming round, I'll escalate my bids by 20% for both A and B, specifically pushing my AB bid to my valuation. This strategy allows me to probe the high range thresholds for wins.

For this round, I'll bid my face value for A ($46), continue bidding down for B ($10), and bid aggressively on AB ($120). This strategy aims to secure either A or AB while minimizing expenditure on B.

For this round, I will continue exploring variations in strategy. I will increase my individual bids: $80 for A and $65 for B. Considering my high combined value, I will place an aggressive bid of $360 on AB, aiming to gather pragmatic insights from this approach.

For the next round, I'll increase my bid on A and B by 10% and bid above my AB value by 20%. I will monitor profits closely and recalibrate my bidding based on outcomes to maximize my long-term profit.

I'll place an aggressive bid for AB around 360, given its high potential value. For individual items, I'll bid slightly above my valuation for A and B, around 80 and 90 respectively. This dual strategy aims for both immediate and higher future profits.

I will calibrate my bidding, lowering bids for A, B and AB aiming to outbid competitors by a smaller margin. This adjustment, while maintaining winning chances, might increase profits. Exploring this conservative approach will aid further strategy optimization, ensuring a data-driven, long-term profitable course.

Based on previous rounds, I'll reduce my bid on A to $50 and refrain from aggressive bidding on B due to its low value. As for AB, I intend to test bidding slightly higher than my combined value of individual goods while observing outcomes carefully for strategic adjustments.

I'll implement a conservative strategy by reducing bids for A and B to just above second highest previous bids. For AB, I'll maintain a high but calculated bid, considering competition response and potential profit maximization. Learning and adapting based on previous rounds is key to success.

This round, I will bid $67 on B, since lesser bids led to a loss previously. My bid for A will remain at $17, and for AB, I'll raise it to $361, aiming to maximize the profitability from the high combined value of AB.
I plan to bid exactly my value for A and B. For AB, I intend to bid above my value by $20 to navigate through the high competition. I will make adjustments according to the auction outcomes.

I'll employ a cautious strategy, bidding slightly above my valuations for both A and B, about $98 and $5 respectively. For AB, considering my high combined valuation of $196, I'll bid aggressively around $210 to test if I can secure it at a profitable price. This strategy blends caution and competitiveness.

For the upcoming round, I'll review AB bids and aim to marginally outbid the second highest bidder, maximizing potential gains. Concurrently, I'll scale down individual item bids to just above competitors, ensuring wins while minimizing investment. Monitoring bid histories will continue influencing strategy refinements.

In the next round, I'll reduce my bids for A and B by $10 and $64 respectively, testing lower thresholds. For AB, I'll bid down by $30, exploring potential for higher profits while maintaining competitive bids.

Considering my high valuations, I'll bid slightly over my values (58 for A, 74 for B). Additionally, to compete for AB, I'll bid higher (250). By incrementally adjusting my bids, I aim to strike a balance between profitability and winning likelihood.

Continuing to carefully balance risks and rewards, I will explore strategies including partial aggressive bidding, keeping bids close to valuation for lower risk. If the AB combined value is sufficiently high, I will aggressively bid on AB, while still maintaining moderate bids on A and B.

Increase bid for A to $58 and for B to $14 to secure goods against last round bids. Raise AB bid to $86, still bidding below valuation, to gauge competition for bundle. Monitor profit margins and adapt bids accordingly for future rounds.

In this round, I'll bid my actual values for A and B (24 and 79, respectively). For the AB bundle, I'll make an aggressive bid slightly above the total value of A and B, say 210, to secure a potentially high profit outcome if won.

As my combined value (AB) remains high, I'll focus on bidding competitively for AB while maintaining balanced, lower-risk bids on A and B. Observing competitors' behaviors and refining strategies, I'll aim to secure profitable outcomes while minimizing potential losses, contributing to my long-term gain.

In the next round, focus on high-value item B, increasing bid by $20. Simultaneously, slightly increase bid on A. Keep AB bid closer to its actual valuation, testing an aggressive strategy for higher returns. Adjust future plans according to success of this strategy.

Given my values for A (71) and B (42) this round, I'll bid these amounts for the items. For AB, considering past bids, I'll place a bid slightly above the previous highest bid, say 370, with the intention of securing a profitable bundle.

In the next rounds, I'll attempt to balance risky bidding for AB when my combined value is high, with more conservative bid strategies for A and B. Continual analysis of other bidders' patterns will help fine-tune these approaches, ultimately aiming to maximize long-term profits.

For the next round, I'll elevate B's bid by $25 due to its high value. Slightly increment A's bid by $5. Increase AB's bid closer to its actual value to test the aggressive strategy for higher profits. I'll continue to adapt plans based on outcomes.

Considering past outcomes, I'll bid a bit lower than my value for items A and B (23 and 81). For AB, I'll bid slightly above the combined value of A and B (about 214), aiming for profit maximization, while adapting based on competition.

For this round, I'll look to increase my bids to secure either A, B or AB. Specifically, I'll bid $70 on A, given its lower competition. For B, I'll bid aggressively at $90. With the high combined value, I'll bid robustly on AB at $370.
